results.title: Germany’s Far Right Is Nowhere in the Election. But It’s ‘Here to Stay.’
results.abstract: In the next national Parliament, the far-right Alternative for Germany party is likely to remain a pariah force. But it looks assured, too, of a role in shaping the country’s future.

multimedia.caption: Supporters of the far-right Alternative for Germany party, or AfD, at a rally last month. The party’s popularity has slipped since the last elections, but the AfD looks likely to stay in Parliament.

results.title: France, Striving for Global Power, Still Struggles to Get It
results.abstract: Though often seen as vanity or pique, France’s assertiveness abroad is calibrated to manage a quandary it has faced since World War II: how to act as an independent power while depending on allies.

results.title: Top Adviser to Ukrainian President Is Targeted in an Assassination Attempt
results.abstract: President Volodymyr Zelensky said he would return to Ukraine from New York immediately. The adviser, Serhiy Shefir, was unharmed, but his driver was shot and wounded in the attack.
